thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS ROUNDUP: Bishop Connolly senior Nick Avilla swings into state golf final
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS ROUNDUP: Bishop Connolly senior Nick Avilla swings into state golf final

title: HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS ROUNDUP: Bishop Connolly senior Nick Avilla swings into state golf final
text: HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS ROUNDUP: Bishop Connolly senior Nick Avilla swings into state golf final Comment The Herald News, Fall River, MA Writer Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:02 PM Updated at 10:29 PM Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:02 PM Updated at 10:29 PM Herald News Staff Nick Avilla, Bishop Connolly’s senior captain, shot a 78 on Monday to take fourth place at the MIAA Division 3 South Shore Sectional golf qualifier at Glen Ellen Country Club (par 72) in Millis. Avilla qualified for the state final next week at Cummaquid Country Club in Yarmouth. The South Shore qualifier included 62 players, with the top two teams and top six individuals advancing to Cummaquid. “I don’t have any idea when the last time anyone from Connolly golf has reached the state finals, but I do know this a great accomplishment for Nick and the school,” Connolly coach Lowell Metivier said. Field Hockey Westport 6, Wareham 0: At Wareham, Cassandra Abgrab scored three goals and assisted on another. Amanda Matos had two goals and an assist and Sarah Duarte added a goal and an assist. Laura Mendell also assisted. Elizabeth Mulroy made one save for the shutout The Wildcats (4-9-0-) were coming off a 4-2 win over Fairhaven in which Matos and Abgrab both scored twice. Tiverton 2, Burrillville 0: At Tiverton, Hailey Robinson and Samantha Cookinham scored for the Tigers in this Rhode Island Division II game. Julia Vasconcelos and Julienne Hughes had the assists. Winning goalie Allison Ramos made two saves. Apponequet 2, Durfee 1: At Durfee, Hailey Michael scored a second-half goal for the Hilltoppers in this non-league loss. Volleyball Somerset Berkley 3, Bishop Connolly 0: At Lafrance Gymnasium in Fall River, senior Rebecca Foley had 11 assists and 10 service points as the Raiders (8-6) won 25-7, 25-23, 25-10. Breanna Wood unloaded nine kills and had three digs, and Hope Estrella had three kills and two blocks. Somerset Berkley plays at Durfee on Tuesday. Bourne 3, Case 2: At Bourne, the Cardinals (13-2, 12-1 league) endured their first South Coast Conference loss of the season, 21-25, 27-25, 13-25, 25-23, 15-11. Allyson DiCesare had 14 kills and Jordan Martin had 15 digs and 13 service points. Bishop Feehan 3, Bishop Stang 1: At O'Brien Gymnasium in Dartmouth, Maeve Ennis (3 blocks, all-around strong play) and Lauren Jackson (5 aces, 4 kills) were standouts for the Spartans (5-9, 1-3 league) in this 21-25, 25-20, 25-7, 25-14 Eastern Athletic Conference loss. Boys’ Soccer Bishop Connolly 2, Coyle & Cassidy 1: At Bishop Connolly High School in Fall River, the Cougars (11-1-1) avenged their only loss as sophomores Reuben Farias and John Aguiar scored. Keeper Justin Cooper preserved the win with a diving save with six minutes remaining. Aguiar broke the 1-1 tie on a penalty kick with about 24 minutes remaining after drawing the foul in the box. Page 2 of 2 - Coyle & Cassidy had beaten Connolly 2-0 in Connolly’s first game of the season. Bourne 3, Case 1: At Cardinal Stadium, Skylah Dias scored for the Cardinals in this South Coast Conference loss. Ryan Nascimento assisted on the Case goal. Girls’ Soccer Bourne 6, Case 1: At Bourne, Katie LePage, assisted by Tayla Chaput, scored for the Cardinals in this South Coast Conference loss. The Herald News, Fall River, MA Writer Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:02 PM Updated at 10:29 PM
